tasks.task: Operating a hay baler on a farm.
subtasks: Aligning the baler with the windrow.
Activating the baler to compress the hay.
Monitoring the filling level of the feeder house.
Adjusting speed to prevent hay from building up under the tractor.
Ensuring even distribution of the windrow into the baler.
Maneuvering the tractor to follow the windrow.
Engaging gears smoothly for efficient operation.
Adjusting feeder house rods for optimal compaction.
Observing back pressure to gauge hay quantity.
Backing up to clear hay buildup.
Observing for potential plugging at windrow intersections.

tasks.task: The transcript details the operation of a hay baler and tractor, focusing on tasks like aligning the baler with the windrow, managing hay flow into the feeder house, adjusting tractor speed, troubleshooting plugging, and monitoring the baler's performance. These activities are essential for efficient baling on a farm. Answer: MAINTASK: Operating a hay baler on a farm.
